posts.name: randomfoo
posts.cooked:
I recently upgraded my phone (iOS) and was trying to move my messages over. To my surprised I found that I couldn’t, but found some related open issues on the matter in the Github project (#905 and #2542 (where I asked about the status)). To my surprise when I returned I found #2542 was locked by @michaelkirk but he did not give an update to any of the questions asks about how to backup or export messages.

He did, however point people to the forums here. So, as an iOS user who regretfully used Signal, what are my options here? I have my email threads from the early 90s, and my ICQ and AIM logs from the late 90s and 2000s, but it looks like I have no access to the past year of Signal messages on my device?

What kind of stupid security hack do I need to be able to extract my history logs from this terrible app? Will an iOS 11 jailbreak do or are the apps databases further encrypted? If I ever reset my phone does that mean all my messages are lost forever? (even w/ a full device backup?)

link_counts.title: Save messages for import when moving phones · Issue #905 · WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS · GitHub

posts.cooked: I agree, a possibility to export plaintext backups like on android would be nice.

randomfoo:

To my surprise when I returned I found #2542 was locked by @michaelkirk but he did not give an update to any of the questions asks about how to backup or export messages.

Bug tracker is for tracking bugs not for discussion on anything else then bugs. Forums are for discussion. We need to understand Open Whisper System has extremely small development team, so any drift out of focus, like discussion on bug tracker, we are eating there valuable time they are focusing on development, new features or fixing bugs. They have internal list of feature they would like to implement, one of them is full backup. I fully understand that full backup is very important to you, but for example it is completely unimportant to me - I use Signal for transport of info, anything important I save outside of Signal. I am not saying this feature is not important to a lot of people. But in my humble opinion we need to be little bit patient and let them prioritize the features.

randomfoo:

an iOS user who regretfully used Signal

and

randomfoo:

What kind of stupid security hack do I need to be able to extract my history logs from this terrible app?

I understand your frustration, but negative energy will not solve anything. Being nice, polite and humble is the way to go in order to expect anyone to sacrifice valuable free time to help you in the first place. But in my humble opinion, if you would really hate Signal you would stop using it, but you know how good it is and would like to make it better. You are frustrated, but you care.

And to the main problem, backup, there is currently no official way to do a backup of Signal data. Open Whisper System have a list of feature they will implement. This feature is one of the top feature they will implement, I am sure of that, too many users asking for this, but we just need to be patient. There was plenty of discussion on this topic already on forum, see backup search result: Search results for 'backup' - Signal Community
You wouldn’t want just the very limited plaintext backups of the Android version, but rather full backups, like e.g. WhatsApp’s.

A more complete Backup function would be nice for all OS’ but porting Android’s plaintext backups to iOS would be a helpful start from my perspective, my background for chiming in here was mainly a tool I wrote for a friend to be able to see all messages between her and a certain user in one fully loaded page (as opposed to having to endlessly scroll up with loading times between each batch of messages)- just to then realize this is unusable for her due to her being on iOS.
I know this is a special case but I assume it would be helpful for a lot of people wanting to move their messages to another device without having to rely on iCloud.
[edited for typo]

Is there any indication when backups/exports (for iOS) might be implemented?

Such indication would help adjusting the next iPhone migration date. The github roadmap seems to be outdated. (Talking about version 2.14, when 2.19 is already in production.)

posts.name: Kindanduseful
posts.cooked:
Hello!
I also really wish for this feature’s existence. Thank you!

posts.name: Jeffrey Warren
posts.cooked:
Me too. I’d love to advocate for friends to use Signal and think this is a critical feature, thank you!

I do see a bounty for this feature here: Bountysource

Would it be helpful to add to the bounty to get this fixed?

Thanks again and hi, @michaelkirk! Hope you’re well!

There is now a branch in the iOS repository named “backup”!! https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS/commits/charlesmchen/backup
I really do hope that it means what the title says…

From source code it really looks like full database backup is being prepared. From source code:

  • locking whole database files,
  • coping them,
  • encrypting them with AES algorithm,
  • using user defined backup password (optional),
  • compressing backup with zip algorithm,
  • sending them,
  • storing them to cloud (optional)

It looks like full backup of Signal database is finally coming (at least for Signal/iOS).

posts.name: Matthew Chen
posts.cooked: Sorry to disappoint but this work only represents a first step towards backup for users. This branch implements a similar feature for internal testing purposes only.
Ahh, I was afraid this might be the case! Thanks for the heads up, though!

posts.name: Kevinp2
posts.cooked:
I would love to see this happen. I have been recommending Signal to many and even got my family members onto it so that we could coordinate a property sale negotiation securely. They will be bummed to discover that they cannot get their messages out of it.

Ideas for an implementation:

  1. Full backup/export of all conversations, including group conversations and attachments.

1b) Would be nice: Partial backup/export based upon contact name. I should be able to select from a list of users and all messages related to them (including in group conversations) should be exportable.

  1. User should be required to provide a strong password when starting the backup/export.

  2. All data should be placed in a single ZIP file and encrypted using the password.

  3. This file should be “Shareable” using the existing mechanisms built into iOS - email, message, AirDrop, DropBox, etc.

On the import side:

  1. Provide the password

  2. Existing messages should not be duplicated if they already exist, i.e. the import should check to see if any message already exists in the new device.

Thanks for your great work!

accepted_answer.name: Salt
accepted_answer.excerpt:
It seems the future of iOS backups will be likely be cloud backups. Therefore we’re closing this thread in favor of the Encrypted Cloud Backups feature request:

Encrypted cloud backups Feature Requests
This would be great feature that can be implement with schedule backup. ex: backup every 30/60/90/180/etc and keep the most X number of backups. this way we can restore if ever needed

Relevant information from a former Signal developer here:

imperiopolis-signal:

Posted Nov 12, 2020
It is highly unlikely we will ever build a file based backup system for iOS. In addition to it being an unfamiliar experience for iOS users, part of our decision making to not build such a system for iOS was based on how much of a nightmare supporting such a system has been for the Android team, both technically making sure it continues to work with any backup file from any version as well as via our support channels where user’s just don’t understand at all how it works. The future for moving your data between devices in Signal likely looks like a choice between direct peer-to-peer transfer or restoration from some form of secure network storage.
